p: Our results also demonstrated that during the last glacial maximum there was a significant increase in the areas of habitat suitability of almost all of the species we studied, except for C. stolzmanni, Chacophrys pierotti, L. laevis, and L. llanensis (whose probability of presence seems larger under more warmer climate), which, despite the low sampling, can be associated for variations in temperature and regime of rains, modulate by South America Monsoon System during this period, which changed the structuration of biomes, mainly in central region of South America, in approximately 18,000 years ago, especially in the Chaco, which coincided with the greatest extensions of the polar ice caps [ 43].
